Low: Anonymity - Client or faction involvement must remain secret.
Bad Weather - A severe storm or magical weather event moves into the area.
Guild Training Mission - An easy mission conducted under guild supervision.
Guild Advancement Mission - Standard mission tied to rank advancement.
Hostile Territory - Objective lies in or beyond hostile terrain requiring caution.
Leave a Calling Card - Job must visibly show who was responsible.
Low Collateral Damage - Must not damage property or personnel beyond the target.
Quiet Job - Must be done without attracting attention or witnesses.
Undamaged - Objective must be recovered intact and unharmed.
Moderate: Easy Job Gone Wrong - Supposedly simple job complicated by bad intel or new enemies.
Interference - Someone or something attempts to block the mission’s success.
Forced Choice - Time-sensitive issue forces adventurers to choose between goals.
Frame Job - Mission must make it appear that another group or nation was responsible.
Make it Look Like an Accident - Success requires subtlety and deception to appear natural.
Race Against Time - Objective must be reached before a deadline or environmental collapse.
Race to the Finish - Competing group tries to complete the same objective first.
Rivals - Another party seeks the same goal and may interfere.
Time Limit - Quest must be started or finished within a specific time window.
Stolen - Target or objective is missing or taken before arrival.
High: Moral Dilemma - Completing the quest causes major ethical or world consequences.
Rigged Game - The quest was designed to fail or scapegoat the party.
Make it Messy - Brutality and chaos are required or encouraged.
Frame Job (if discovered) - Political or social fallout if deception is exposed.
